Observation of external scanning activit.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and http.log from public-facing devices. Identify connections targeting unusual ports or paths, or patterns indicative of scanning tools. Correlate source IPs with known scanners or threat intel feeds. Use frequency analysis or time series analysis to identify spikes in connection attempts to vulnerable services.

Unusual internal reconnaissance activity.Data: Windows Event ID 4688; Windows Event ID 4663; Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log
Unusual internal reconnaissance activity.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for execution of known vulnerability scanning or testing tools. Monitor Windows Event ID 4663 and Zeek logs for unusual access attempts or connection patterns to specific internal systems, services, or files potentially targeted based on acquired vulnerability information. Use correlation analysis to link internal scanning activity to external recon or prior access events.

Network traffic attempting connections t.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek ssl.log
Network traffic attempting connections t.Action: Filter Zeek conn.log for connections to ports commonly associated with vulnerable services (e.g., outdated RDP, SMB, web server versions). Analyze Zeek http.log for requests attempting to access known vulnerable paths or using specific HTTP headers/methods associated with exploits. Analyze Zeek ssl.log for client/server hellos potentially revealing software versions. Use correlation analysis to link connection attempts to known vulnerable services or versions identified through external vulnerability scanning data or intel feeds. Use frequency analysis on destination ports/services to identify unusual targeting patterns.

Anomalous process execution or network c.Data: Windows Event ID 4688; Windows Event ID 5156; Zeek conn.log
Anomalous process execution or network c.Action: Identify internal hosts running software versions with known, recent vulnerabilities (requires external vulnerability data). Monitor these specific hosts for unusual process execution (Windows Event ID 4688) or network connections (Windows Event ID 5156, Zeek conn.log) originating from or targeting processes associated with the vulnerable software. Use correlation analysis to link these host activities to prior external scanning or internal reconnaissance detected in network logs. Use time series analysis to identify bursts of activity or repeated connection attempts targeting these vulnerable hosts.
